title: Logging in to my nsi account
content: Firefox is my default browser. Every time I try to log on to my nsi (National Savings) account with Firefox I find that I usually have to put my log-in details twice, even after it seems to go through the authorisation of device process. Also I have to repeatedly accept cookies if I do manage to get into my account. It is so bad I generally turn to Chrome for logging on to my nsi account as this is always straightforward. I complained to nsi but they assure me the problem lies with my browser. Is there something in Firefox settings I need to adjust to get around this nsi log in problem?
creator: grtate

title: New Firefox installations sync pinned shortcuts the wrong way
content:
Hi All!

Every time I install Firefox on a computer and log in to sync, the pinned shortcuts sync happens the wrong way. So the new installation gets a collection of relatively random shortcuts for websites I visit, plus a few of the default ones (with the search option/magnifying glass feature integrated) for sites I don't really visit, then this is synced on all other computers. I have to go manually on one of the others and redo the pinned shortcuts, then this syncs everywhere.

I've had the issue for years. I work from multiple computers so the sync feature is invaluable but also extremely annoying that I have to redo a couple of dozens pinned shortcuts every time I install and sync a new Firefox. The rest of the sync works fine (bookmarks, etc.).

Am I doing something wrong or is Firefox unable to properly sync pinned shortcuts? I imagine I can migrate the profiles over all the time but the benefit of the sync feature is that it's seamless so I'd rather use that if possible.

Thank you!
creator: v_a

title: Firefox speaks every text or section that i click
content:
Hello

I accidently hit a few keys and afterwards Firefox started to mark the sections yellow and speaks everything I do or the text i click. I just appears on the one website, the one I was as i pressed the keys. I thinks its a feature from Firefox, because the windows voice assistant is deactivated.

In the image you can see the title marked yellow, I clicked it and a female voice speaks it or when i click a section they say "section landmark"

Thanks for helping

title: Firefox PDF - add option to highlight text
content:
Hi, I really appreciate the work on PDF.js and I hope to eventually not use any proprietary software (looking at the bloated Adobe Reader...) for pdf files anymore.

The thing I am missing most right now: the option to highlight text.

There is a workaround by selecting the draw tool with 50% opacity/thickness and using a light color, but it's not the same as just highlighting text like in other pdf viewers.

Best, przvl

title: Autenticazione Cie
content:
Buongiorno,

Ho provato ad accedere ad un servizio della PA con la CIE ma vengo bloccato dalla richiesta della password per il token PKCS#11 CIE con il messaggio che vi invio in allegato. Quale Password devo inserire, ho provato il PIN della CIE ma non la accetta, ho provato le utlime 4 cifre del PIN della CIE ma non accetta neppure queste, cosa devo fare?

Preciso che questa autenticazione non funziona con il browser Mozilla Firefox mentre funziona con Microsoft Edge. Io voglio utilizzare Mozilla Firefox.

Grazie per l'assistenza che vorrete darmi.

Cordiali saluti

Costantino Nieddu

title: video failed to load
content: I attempted to load a video from Anaconda and got the following error: "Sorry, the video player failed to load.(Error Code: 104153)" My search of the web was not fruitful. There was a rather broad suggestion to try another browser. For the first time in MANY years i downloaded Microsoft Edge. I could then open the video from Anaconda. A couple of years ago I went from Windows to Linux because I did not like the access that Microsoft had inside my computer. I would REALLY like to uninstall Edge and go back to Firefox. I feel much more secure that way. Thanks Mike Whitney
creator: 69recon63

title: US Goverment website doesn't support Firefox ESR 102.10.0esr (Debian)
content:
My platform is Debian 11.6: My FireFox install is 102.10.0esr (64-bit)

I was assisting my wife in making an appointment at the US Embassy in Manila via the US Embassy website. It all worked correctly *until* I chose the appointment day and time and clicked to continue. Rather than confirm the appointment, it told me I needed an up-to-date browser that supported 128 bit encryption. Now I know FireFox does support that. The screen looked like it thought I was using Netscape!

I switched to Chrome (much to my annoyance) and the website worked. This is not the first time I have found that I have to abandon FireFox to do something when using it on Linux. I haven't been on Windows for a while, but I don't remember this problem on that platform. This is a real problem. Please fix it. There is no reason why a website should think FireFox is Netscape.
creator: MikeLieberman

creator: karlchess27

title: Firefox huge use of RAM is crashing my apps
content:
Firefox is always using HUGE amount of my RAM with several window opened far more than my tabs.

But since the last update this has really got out of hand, crashing my apps. (Windows 10, 64 bit Desktop PC)

I work with media apps which DO require a lot of memory, such as Adobe Audition, and last night Audition first slowed down and then crashed while I was rushing to finish an urgent project.

I thought what the heck is going on - opened Task Manager - and lo and behold Firefox had several windows running taking up 85% of memory which I needed for my app!! I had only 5 -6 tabs opened in the browser - this is insane! every new update you release is more memory hungry - and I do NOT have ANY extensions and my computer is quite powerful designed for media work.

I found online advice to click on Minimise Memory button in about:memory - which I did.

But this should not be an OPTION which you have to guess how to disable! This has to be included in the Firefox SETTINGS!

So now, until you REDUCE this memory hunger I have to close the browser while working on my apps, or use another browser altogether.

Are there Firefox developers on this forum to reply?
creator: etcetera777

title: firefox suddenly started asking for permission to update
content: Hello, in the past, firefox never asked for permission when it updated itself, but yesterday it asked for permission (do you want to allow this app to make changes on your device) when I started it. Is that something to be concerned about (e.g. Virus etc.) I haven't changed any firefox/windows settings, am using windows 10, firefox version 112.0.1. I have admin privileges. Thank you.
creator: byejessieli
